title: Hyperekplexia: Rare Genetic Disorder Overview
short_description: Clinical overview of hyperekplexia, a rare genetic disorder affecting approximately 1 in 40,000 people in the United States.
long_description: This document provides essential information about hyperekplexia, a rare genetic disorder that typically manifests at birth but can have delayed onset until adolescence or adulthood in some cases. The condition affects both males and females equally and has an estimated prevalence of one in 40,000 people in the United States. This clinical reference material serves as an introductory resource for understanding the basic epidemiological characteristics of this uncommon neurological condition.
